intro: Bomarea angamarcana, commonly known as the Angamarcana lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a waxy surface that helps retain moisture.
